intro: Asarca gaudichaudii, commonly known as the New Zealand garlic chive, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas. Asarca gaudichaudii is valued for its culinary uses and has been used by Māori for both food and medicinal purposes.
